abstract: Mayor Michael R Bloomberg, responding to death of carriage horse, says carriage industry is a part of New York City's heritage, beloved by tourists, and that there is no reason to shut it down; requests autopsy for horse, but notes there is no evidence of abuse.
snippet: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the carriage industry was a part of the city’s heritage and beloved by tourists, and there was no reason to shut it down.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Horse and Carriage Assn, New York

lead_paragraph: Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg said the carriage industry was a part of the city’s heritage and beloved by tourists, and there was no reason to shut it down.

headline.main: After Carriage Horse Dies, Mayor Rejects Calls for Ban
headline.print_headline: After Carriage Horse Dies, Mayor Rejects Calls for Ban
headline.seo: Bloomberg Rejects Calls to Ban Horse-Drawn Carriages
